items.sentence: I\'ve already told Tom to be there tomorrow by 2:30.
I\'ve already told you everything I know about that.
I\'ve always had a problem with the way Tom behaves.
Why don\'t you tell me what\'s really bothering you?
People don\'t visit Boston as often as they used to.
Please tell Tom that I don\'t want to see him again.
Do you think men and women can ever just be friends?
I\'m the one who took the bandage off of Tom\'s arm.
Tom was able to get into the house through a window.
Tom was about to take a bath when the doorbell rang.
Tom was as drunk as a skunk the last time I saw him.
Tom was beginning to wish he had stayed in the navy.
Tom was diagnosed with leukemia on October 20, 2013.
You\'re supposed to be helping Tom now, aren\'t you?
Tom asked Mary to get some glasses from the kitchen.
Tom asked Mary to go to the store to buy some bread.
Tom asked Mary to teach him how to play the ukulele.
Tom asked Mary what kind of books she liked to read.
Tom said he couldn\'t remember his own phone number.
Tom said that he didn\'t think that Mary was hungry.
